intro: Catostemma macrosperma, commonly known as the broad-seeded catostemma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stem, opposite leaves, and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It produces large, fleshy fruits that contain numerous seeds, aiding in its dispersal. Catostemma macrosperma is often found in rocky or disturbed habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
